name: Array with a "hole"
instruction:
Write a function `arrWithHole` that takes one parameter, an array.

The array consists of numbers in which the second element can be `undefined`.

The function returns the value of the second element of the array.

If the second element of the array is `undefined` - assign to it the value of the sum of the first and the last element of the array.

Otherwise, raise the second element of the array to the power of the third element of the array.

An example of running a function:
```javascript
arrWithHole([11, 2, 5, 13, 3]) // 2 ** 5 = 32
arrWithHole([13, undefined, 3, 51, 87]) // 13 + 87 = 100
```
